alert.note: Alert for George; Greene (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:34AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, Washington, central Clarke, northeastern George and southeastern Greene Counties through 215 AM CST... At 134 AM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Fruitdale to 4 miles northwest of Deer Park to 9 miles west of Citronelle to 8 miles northeast of Lucedale. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Citronelle, Lucedale, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Gulfcrest, Deer Park, Tibbie, Calvert, Mount Vernon, Fruitdale, McIntosh and Movico. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southeastern Mississippi.
